intro: Echinops sheilae, commonly known as the Sheil's thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that resemble a crown of thorns. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Echinops sheilae is often used in ornamental gardening due to its distinctive appearance and drought tolerance.
